author: rhuijben
msg: * STATUS: Cast some votes, approving the r38229 group.

author: hwright
msg: apr_hash_clear(), which isn't available until apr 1.3.0.

author: hwright
msg: Remove an unused function, and several tests for it.
Now that conflicts are stored in a hash, we don't need an API which checks
for them: that's what apr_hash_get() is for!

author: hwright
msg: Switch the tree conflict parsing/unparsing to use a hash rather than an
array.  This makes searching for individual members and removing specific
items much easier (and also helps support future tree conflict data
Use a hash for reading/writing the conflicts list.
Read and iterate over a tree conflicts hash.
(svn_wc__read_tree_conflicts): Put tree conflicts into a hash when reading
(svn_wc__write_tree_conflicts): Pull tree conflicts from the hash when
Instead of looping over an array, just use the appropriate entry in the
(log_runner): Use a hash instead of an array for the tree_conflicts member.
(log_do_add_conflict): Use hash operations in place of array ones.
